item.title: John add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "I wished to see storms only on those coasts where they raged with most violence..." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: John add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Most timidities have such secret compensations and Miss Bart was discerning enough to know that the inner vanity is generally in proportion to the outer self depreciation." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: John add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The variations of the Duchess's judgment spared no one, except her husband. He alone had never been in love with her, in him she had always felt an iron character, indifferent to the caprices that she displayed, contemptuous of her beauty, violent, of a will that would never bend, the sort under which alone nervous people can find tranquillity." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: John add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "...the nose is generally the organ in which stupidity is most readily displayed." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: John add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "You're as strong as the Pont Neuf. You'll live to bury us all!" -- Marcel Proust

item.title: John add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "...because he knew that for other people their own social obligations took precedence of the death of a friend, and could put himself in her place by dint of his instinctive politeness." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: John add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "When you've nothing else construct ceremonies out of the air and breathe upon them." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: John add a quote by Dorothy Draper
item.description: "I believe in doing the thing you feel is right. If it looks right, it is right." -- Dorothy Draper
